meanings.definition: To touch or stroke lightly with the fingers or a feather.
meanings.sent1: I will tickle you with this feather.
meanings.sent2: She loves it when you tickle her feet.
meanings.sent3: Tickle the baby's belly to make her giggle.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays tickle my skin as I lay in the grass.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze tickles the leaves on the trees.

meanings.definition: A sensation caused by light touching or stroking.
meanings.sent1: His laughter was a result of the tickle on his neck.
meanings.sent2: The tickle in her throat made her cough.
meanings.sent3: The tickle of excitement spread through the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The tickle of curiosity urged her to open the mysterious box.
meanings.sent5: The tickle of fear crept up her spine as she entered the dark room.
